alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 10:05AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, southwest, and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in central Oklahoma, Canadian. In southwest Oklahoma, Caddo. In western Oklahoma, Custer and Washita. * WHEN...Until 115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1004 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Weatherford, Hinton, Binger, Corn, Eakly, Lookeba, Colony, Albert, Fort Cobb Reservoir, Alfalfa, Cogar and Cedar Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
